text:
e="preserve">Martin Davorin Jagodić (16 December 1935 – 8 March 2020) was a Croatian contemporary music composer and educator. He was born in Pag, Croatia. Jagodić composed music for several experimental movies, starting with "Environment" in 1969.
His career as an educator started in 1969 as assistant and then lecturer at the music department of Université de Vincennes Paris 8, later also teaching stage design and scenography at Ecole Nationale Supérieure des Arts Décoratifs from 1974 to 1988.
In the 1990s, he taught musicology at Université de Saint-Denis, after the "Université de Vincennes Paris 8" had relocated there in 1980. He died on 8 March 2020 in Auxerre, France at the age of 84.
